originalText.text: Scott was very influential in helping me do my best on the SAT. My biggest concern going in was the math section, as I kept getting scores that I was not happy about when I took practice tests. After two and a half months of tutoring with Scott, I started to understand some of the more difficult math concepts that had gone over my head when they were taught in class, and I also learned some test-taking strategies that were extremely useful in helping me hone in on the right answer.  I started to see my scores begin to increase, which really motivated me to keep studying. We also worked a little on improving my grammar and essay-writing skills for other parts of test.  I felt very supported working with Scott and he was a great motivator. I recommend Scott if you are trying to improve your scores significantly and if you also want an enjoyable SAT test prep experience.

originalText.text: I was introduced to Scott by the learning specialist at my son’s private middle school. My son was having trouble in math and was falling quite a bit behind. Since working with Scott, my son’s grades and scores in math have steadily improved, but perhaps more importantly, he gained a boatload of confidence about his ability to do well and manage the work. Scott is a very gifted tutor who intuitively understands how kids think, and we couldn't be happier with the outcome. I recommend him highly!

originalText.text: My daughter did not want to take a prep class at Kaplan or Princeton Review as we felt that she would benefit most from one on one tutoring. We wanted a personalized approach with a  tutor working on the specific areas and problems that my duaghter struggled with. Scott Spizer matched my daughter with a tutor who knew a lot about the SAT and all the different strategies of preparation. We really appreciated the individualised approach and my daughter's score improved more than we had hoped. She is still in touch with her tutor for academic advice, which says a lot about the quality of people working at Origins Tutoring.

originalText.text: Daniel worked over the spring semester with Scott preparing for the ACT.  He started at a composite 29 and jumped to a 33!! Daniel worked really hard, but he could not have reached his goal without Scott, whose instruction and advice proved invaluable.
